ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would certainly recommend this class as a close reading of four major Spanish poets and their connections to larger movements of romanticism and symbolism in Spain.
Yes, I would totally recommend it. You really learn how to analyze poetry.
Excellent authors, good background information, definitely would recommend it for the aforementioned reasons.
I would absolutely recommend this course to a fellow student because it is such a great course in every aspect.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: There are very few seminars about poetry in our department, and Professor Valis' seminar was a refreshing and most welcome addition to the department's courses offered this semester!
Helped me strengthen my skills as a poetry critic.

Gave excellent introduction to Romantic and post-romantic poetry and poetics in Spain. Good preparation for exams and authors were highly influential therefore fundamental in our discipline. My dissertation may very well touch on one of the authors in this course.

While this course is not in my particular area of interest/research, I have benefited tremendously for having taken it, as it's analysis of poetry and, particularly, the poetry of writers that were so modern and so close to being avant-garde (consciously or not), has provided a foundation of precursors to the writers that I will eventually study more in-depth.
